description: Creates a new DB cluster from a DB snapshot or DB cluster snapshot. If a DB snapshot is specified, the target DB cluster is created from the source DB snapshot with a default configuration and default security group. If a DB cluster snapshot is specified, the target DB cluster is created from the source DB cluster restore point with the same configuration as the original source DB cluster, except that the new DB cluster is created with the default security group.

parameters.name: AvailabilityZones
parameters.description: Provides the list of EC2 Availability Zones that instances in the restored DB cluster can be created in. (string) ---

parameters.name: DBClusterIdentifier
parameters.description: The name of the DB cluster to create from the DB snapshot or DB cluster snapshot. This parameter isn't case-sensitive. Constraints: Must contain from 1 to 63 letters, numbers, or hyphens First character must be a letter Cannot end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens Example: my-snapshot-id.

parameters.name: SnapshotIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier for the DB snapshot or DB cluster snapshot to restore from. You can use either the name or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to specify a DB cluster snapshot. However, you can use only the ARN to specify a DB snapshot. Constraints: Must match the identifier of an existing Snapshot.

parameters.name: Engine
parameters.description: The database engine to use for the new DB cluster. Default: The same as source Constraint: Must be compatible with the engine of the source.

parameters.name: Port
parameters.description: The port number on which the new DB cluster accepts connections. Constraints: Value must be 1150-65535 Default: The same port as the original DB cluster.

parameters.name: DBSubnetGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the DB subnet group to use for the new DB cluster. Constraints: If supplied, must match the name of an existing DBSubnetGroup. Example: mySubnetgroup.

parameters.name: VpcSecurityGroupIds
parameters.description: A list of VPC security groups that the new DB cluster will belong to. (string) ---

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: The tags to be assigned to the restored DB cluster. (dict) --- Metadata assigned to an Amazon Neptune resource consisting of a key-value pair. Key (string) --- A key is the required name of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with aws: or rds:. The string can only contain the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, --_', --.', --/', --=', --+', ---' (Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-]*)$'). Value (string) --- A value is the optional value of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 256 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with aws: or rds:. The string can only contain the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, --_', --.', --/', --=', --+', ---' (Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-]*)$').

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: A key is the required name of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with aws: or rds:. The string can only contain the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, --_', --.', --/', --=', --+', ---' (Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-]*)$').

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: A value is the optional value of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 256 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with aws: or rds:. The string can only contain the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, --_', --.', --/', --=', --+', ---' (Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-]*)$').

parameters.name: KmsKeyId
parameters.description: The Amazon KMS key identifier to use when restoring an encrypted DB cluster from a DB snapshot or DB cluster snapshot. The KMS key identifier is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the KMS encryption key. If you are restoring a DB cluster with the same Amazon account that owns the KMS encryption key used to encrypt the new DB cluster, then you can use the KMS key alias instead of the ARN for the KMS encryption key. If you do not specify a value for the KmsKeyId parameter, then the following will occur: If the DB snapshot or DB cluster snapshot in SnapshotIdentifier is encrypted, then the restored DB cluster is encrypted using the KMS key that was used to encrypt the DB snapshot or DB cluster snapshot. If the DB snapshot or DB cluster snapshot in SnapshotIdentifier is not encrypted, then the restored DB cluster is not encrypted.

parameters.name: EnableIAMDatabaseAuthentication
parameters.description: True to enable mapping of Amazon Identity and Access Management (IAM) accounts to database accounts, and otherwise false. Default: false.

parameters.name: EnableCloudwatchLogsExports
parameters.description: The list of logs that the restored DB cluster is to export to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. (string) ---

parameters.name: DBClusterParameterGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the DB cluster parameter group to associate with the new DB cluster. Constraints: If supplied, must match the name of an existing DBClusterParameterGroup.

parameters.name: ServerlessV2ScalingConfiguration
parameters.description: Contains the scaling configuration of a Neptune Serverless DB cluster. For more information, see Using Amazon Neptune Serverless in the Amazon Neptune User Guide. MinCapacity (float) --- The minimum number of Neptune capacity units (NCUs) for a DB instance in a Neptune Serverless cluster. You can specify NCU values in half-step increments, such as 8, 8.5, 9, and so on. MaxCapacity (float) --- The maximum number of Neptune capacity units (NCUs) for a DB instance in a Neptune Serverless cluster. You can specify NCU values in half-step increments, such as 40, 40.5, 41, and so on.

nested_params.name: MinCapacity
nested_params.description: The minimum number of Neptune capacity units (NCUs) for a DB instance in a Neptune Serverless cluster. You can specify NCU values in half-step increments, such as 8, 8.5, 9, and so on.

nested_params.name: MaxCapacity
nested_params.description: The maximum number of Neptune capacity units (NCUs) for a DB instance in a Neptune Serverless cluster. You can specify NCU values in half-step increments, such as 40, 40.5, 41, and so on.

parameters.name: StorageType
parameters.description: Specifies the storage type to be associated with the DB cluster. Valid values: standard, iopt1 Default: standard.

nested_items.name: DBCluster
nested_items.description: Contains the details of an Amazon Neptune DB cluster.

nested_items.name: AllocatedStorage
nested_items.description: AllocatedStorage always returns 1, because Neptune DB cluster storage size is not fixed, but instead automatically adjusts as needed.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZones
nested_items.description: Provides the list of EC2 Availability Zones that instances in the DB cluster can be created in.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: BackupRetentionPeriod
nested_items.description: Specifies the number of days for which automatic DB snapshots are retained.

nested_items.name: CharacterSetName
nested_items.description: Not supported by Neptune.

nested_items.name: DatabaseName
nested_items.description: Contains the name of the initial database of this DB cluster that was provided at create time, if one was specified when the DB cluster was created. This same name is returned for the life of the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: DBClusterIdentifier
nested_items.description: Contains a user-supplied DB cluster identifier. This identifier is the unique key that identifies a DB cluster.

nested_items.name: DBClusterParameterGroup
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the DB cluster parameter group for the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: DBSubnetGroup
nested_items.description: Specifies information on the subnet group associated with the DB cluster, including the name, description, and subnets in the subnet group.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Specifies the current state of this DB cluster.

nested_items.name: PercentProgress
nested_items.description: Specifies the progress of the operation as a percentage.

nested_items.name: EarliestRestorableTime
nested_items.description: Specifies the earliest time to which a database can be restored with point-in-time restore.

nested_items.name: Endpoint
nested_items.description: Specifies the connection endpoint for the primary instance of the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: ReaderEndpoint
nested_items.description: The reader endpoint for the DB cluster. The reader endpoint for a DB cluster load-balances connections across the Read Replicas that are available in a DB cluster. As clients request new connections to the reader endpoint, Neptune distributes the connection requests among the Read Replicas in the DB cluster. This functionality can help balance your read workload across multiple Read Replicas in your DB cluster.

nested_items.name: MultiAZ
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the DB cluster has instances in multiple Availability Zones.

nested_items.name: Engine
nested_items.description: Provides the name of the database engine to be used for this DB cluster.

nested_items.name: EngineVersion
nested_items.description: Indicates the database engine version.

nested_items.name: LatestRestorableTime
nested_items.description: Specifies the latest time to which a database can be restored with point-in-time restore.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: Specifies the port that the database engine is listening on.

nested_items.name: MasterUsername
nested_items.description: Not supported by Neptune.

nested_items.name: DBClusterOptionGroupMemberships
nested_items.description: Not supported by Neptune.

nested_items.name: DBClusterOptionGroupName
nested_items.description: Not supported by Neptune.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Not supported by Neptune.

nested_items.name: PreferredBackupWindow
nested_items.description: Specifies the daily time range during which automated backups are created if automated backups are enabled, as determined by the BackupRetentionPeriod.

nested_items.name: PreferredMaintenanceWindow
nested_items.description: Specifies the weekly time range during which system maintenance can occur, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).

nested_items.name: ReplicationSourceIdentifier
nested_items.description: Not supported by Neptune.

nested_items.name: ReadReplicaIdentifiers
nested_items.description: Contains one or more identifiers of the Read Replicas associated with this DB cluster.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: DBClusterMembers
nested_items.description: Provides the list of instances that make up the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: DBInstanceIdentifier
nested_items.description: Specifies the instance identifier for this member of the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: IsClusterWriter
nested_items.description: Value that is true if the cluster member is the primary instance for the DB cluster and false otherwise.

nested_items.name: DBClusterParameterGroupStatus
nested_items.description: Specifies the status of the DB cluster parameter group for this member of the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: PromotionTier
nested_items.description: A value that specifies the order in which a Read Replica is promoted to the primary instance after a failure of the existing primary instance.

nested_items.name: VpcSecurityGroups
nested_items.description: Provides a list of VPC security groups that the DB cluster belongs to.

nested_items.name: VpcSecurityGroupId
nested_items.description: The name of the VPC security group.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the VPC security group.

nested_items.name: HostedZoneId
nested_items.description: Specifies the ID that Amazon Route 53 assigns when you create a hosted zone.

nested_items.name: StorageEncrypted
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the DB cluster is encrypted.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: If StorageEncrypted is true, the Amazon KMS key identifier for the encrypted DB cluster.

nested_items.name: DbClusterResourceId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Region-unique, immutable identifier for the DB cluster. This identifier is found in Amazon CloudTrail log entries whenever the Amazon KMS key for the DB cluster is accessed.

nested_items.name: DBClusterArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: AssociatedRoles
nested_items.description: Provides a list of the Amazon Identity and Access Management (IAM) roles that are associated with the DB cluster. IAM roles that are associated with a DB cluster grant permission for the DB cluster to access other Amazon services on your behalf.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that is associated with the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Describes the state of association between the IAM role and the DB cluster. The Status property returns one of the following values:
ACTIVE - the IAM role ARN is associated with the DB cluster and can be used to access other Amazon services on your behalf.
PENDING - the IAM role ARN is being associated with the DB cluster.
INVALID - the IAM role ARN is associated with the DB cluster, but the DB cluster is unable to assume the IAM role in order to access other Amazon services on your behalf.

nested_items.name: FeatureName
nested_items.description: The name of the feature associated with the Amazon Identity and Access Management (IAM) role. For the list of supported feature names, see  DescribeDBEngineVersions.

nested_items.name: IAMDatabaseAuthenticationEnabled
nested_items.description: True if mapping of Amazon Identity and Access Management (IAM) accounts to database accounts is enabled, and otherwise false.

nested_items.name: CloneGroupId
nested_items.description: Identifies the clone group to which the DB cluster is associated.

nested_items.name: ClusterCreateTime
nested_items.description: Specifies the time when the DB cluster was created, in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC).

nested_items.name: CopyTagsToSnapshot
nested_items.description: If set to true, tags are copied to any snapshot of the DB cluster that is created.

nested_items.name: EnabledCloudwatchLogsExports
nested_items.description: A list of the log types that this DB cluster is configured to export to CloudWatch Logs. Valid log types are: audit (to publish audit logs to CloudWatch) and slowquery (to publish slow-query logs to CloudWatch). See Publishing Neptune logs to Amazon CloudWatch logs.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: PendingModifiedValues
nested_items.description: This data type is used as a response element in the ModifyDBCluster operation and contains changes that will be applied during the next maintenance window.

nested_items.name: PendingCloudwatchLogsExports
nested_items.description: This PendingCloudwatchLogsExports structure specifies pending changes to which CloudWatch logs are enabled and which are disabled.

nested_items.name: LogTypesToEnable
nested_items.description: Log types that are in the process of being deactivated. After they are deactivated, these log types aren't exported to CloudWatch Logs.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: LogTypesToDisable
nested_items.description: Log types that are in the process of being enabled. After they are enabled, these log types are exported to CloudWatch Logs.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: DBClusterIdentifier
nested_items.description: The DBClusterIdentifier value for the DB cluster.

nested_items.name: IAMDatabaseAuthenticationEnabled
nested_items.description: A value that indicates whether mapping of Amazon Web Services Identity and Access Management (IAM) accounts to database accounts is enabled.

nested_items.name: EngineVersion
nested_items.description: The database engine version.

nested_items.name: BackupRetentionPeriod
nested_items.description: The number of days for which automatic DB snapshots are retained.

nested_items.name: StorageType
nested_items.description: The pending change in storage type for the DB cluster. Valid Values:
standard Â  --- ( the default ) Configures cost-effective database storage for applications with moderate to small I/O usage.

iopt1 Â  --- Enables I/O-Optimized storage that's designed to meet the needs of I/O-intensive graph workloads that require predictable pricing with low I/O latency and consistent I/O throughput. Neptune I/O-Optimized storage is only available starting with engine release 1.3.0.0.

nested_items.name: AllocatedStorage
nested_items.description: The allocated storage size in gibibytes (GiB) for database engines. For Neptune, AllocatedStorage always returns 1, because Neptune DB cluster storage size isn't fixed, but instead automatically adjusts as needed.

nested_items.name: Iops
nested_items.description: The Provisioned IOPS (I/O operations per second) value. This setting is only for Multi-AZ DB clusters.

nested_items.name: DeletionProtection
nested_items.description: Indicates whether or not the DB cluster has deletion protection enabled. The database can't be deleted when deletion protection is enabled.

nested_items.name: CrossAccountClone
nested_items.description: If set to true, the DB cluster can be cloned across accounts.

nested_items.name: AutomaticRestartTime
nested_items.description: Time at which the DB cluster will be automatically restarted.

nested_items.name: ServerlessV2ScalingConfiguration
nested_items.description: Shows the scaling configuration for a Neptune Serverless DB cluster.

nested_items.name: MinCapacity
nested_items.description: The minimum number of Neptune capacity units (NCUs) for a DB instance in a Neptune Serverless cluster. You can specify NCU values in half-step increments, such as 8, 8.5, 9, and so on.

nested_items.name: MaxCapacity
nested_items.description: The maximum number of Neptune capacity units (NCUs) for a DB instance in a Neptune Serverless cluster. You can specify NCU values in half-step increments, such as 40, 40.5, 41, and so on.

nested_items.name: GlobalClusterIdentifier
nested_items.description: Contains a user-supplied global database cluster identifier. This identifier is the unique key that identifies a global database.

nested_items.name: IOOptimizedNextAllowedModificationTime
nested_items.description: The next time you can modify the DB cluster to use the iopt1 storage type.

nested_items.name: StorageType
nested_items.description: The storage type used by the DB cluster.
standard Â  --- ( the default ) Provides cost-effective database storage for applications with moderate to small I/O usage.

iopt1 Â  --- Enables I/O-Optimized storage that's designed to meet the needs of I/O-intensive graph workloads that require predictable pricing with low I/O latency and consistent I/O throughput. Neptune I/O-Optimized storage is only available starting with engine release 1.3.0.0.
